trans-unit.source: Reliable Actors Lifecycle
trans-unit.target: Reliable Actors Lifecycle

trans-unit.source: Explains Lifecycle and Garbage Collection for Service Fabric Reliable Actors
trans-unit.target: Explains Lifecycle and Garbage Collection for Service Fabric Reliable Actors

trans-unit.source: Actor lifecycle and Garbage Collection
trans-unit.target: Actor lifecycle and Garbage Collection

trans-unit.source: An Actor is activated when the first call is made to it and it is deactivated (Garbage Collected by Actors runtime) if it is not used for some period of time.
trans-unit.target: An Actor is activated when the first call is made to it and it is deactivated (Garbage Collected by Actors runtime) if it is not used for some period of time.

trans-unit.source: To configure this time period please see section on Actor Garbage Collection below.
trans-unit.target: To configure this time period please see section on Actor Garbage Collection below.

trans-unit.source: What happens on Actor Activation?
trans-unit.target: What happens on Actor Activation?

trans-unit.source: When a call comes for an actor and it is not already active, a new actor is created.
trans-unit.target: When a call comes for an actor and it is not already active, a new actor is created.

trans-unit.source: Its state is loaded (if it is a stateful actor)
trans-unit.target: Its state is loaded (if it is a stateful actor)

trans-unit.source: `OnActivateAsync` method (which can be overridden in actor implementation) is called.
trans-unit.target: `OnActivateAsync` method (which can be overridden in actor implementation) is called.

trans-unit.source: It is added to an Active Actors table.
trans-unit.target: It is added to an Active Actors table.

trans-unit.source: What happens on Actor Deactivation?
trans-unit.target: What happens on Actor Deactivation?

trans-unit.source: When an actor is not used for some period of time, it is removed from the table of Active Actors.
trans-unit.target: When an actor is not used for some period of time, it is removed from the table of Active Actors.

trans-unit.source: `OnDeactivateAsync` method (which can be overridden in actor implementation) is called which clears all the timers for the actor.
trans-unit.target: `OnDeactivateAsync` method (which can be overridden in actor implementation) is called which clears all the timers for the actor.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP] The Fabric Actors runtime emits some [events related to actor activation and deactivation](service-fabric-reliable-actors-diagnostics.md#actor-activation-and-deactivation-events).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP] The Fabric Actors runtime emits some [events related to actor activation and deactivation](service-fabric-reliable-actors-diagnostics.md#actor-activation-and-deactivation-events).

trans-unit.source: They are useful in diagnostics and performance monitoring.
trans-unit.target: They are useful in diagnostics and performance monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Actor Garbage Collection
trans-unit.target: Actor Garbage Collection

trans-unit.source: The Actors runtime periodically scans for actors that have not been used for some period of time, and deactivates them.
trans-unit.target: The Actors runtime periodically scans for actors that have not been used for some period of time, and deactivates them.

trans-unit.source: Once they are deactivated they can be garbage collected by CLR.
trans-unit.target: Once they are deactivated they can be garbage collected by CLR.

trans-unit.source: What counts as “being used” for the purpose of garbage collection?
trans-unit.target: What counts as “being used” for the purpose of garbage collection?

trans-unit.source: Receiving a call.
trans-unit.target: Receiving a call.

trans-unit.source: `IRemindable.ReceiveReminderAsync` method being invoked (applicable only if the actor uses reminders).
trans-unit.target: `IRemindable.ReceiveReminderAsync` method being invoked (applicable only if the actor uses reminders).

trans-unit.source: It is worth noting that if the actor uses timers and its timer callback is invoked, it does **not** count as "being used".
trans-unit.target: It is worth noting that if the actor uses timers and its timer callback is invoked, it does **not** count as "being used".

trans-unit.source: Before going into the details of garbage collection, it is important to define the following terms:
trans-unit.target: Before going into the details of garbage collection, it is important to define the following terms:

trans-unit.source: *Scan interval* - This is the interval at which the Actors runtime scans its Active Actors table for actors that can be garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: *Scan interval* - This is the interval at which the Actors runtime scans its Active Actors table for actors that can be garbage collected.

trans-unit.source: The default value for this is 1 minute.
trans-unit.target: The default value for this is 1 minute.

trans-unit.source: *Idle timeout* - This is the amount of time an actor needs to remain unused (idle) before it can be garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: *Idle timeout* - This is the amount of time an actor needs to remain unused (idle) before it can be garbage collected.

trans-unit.source: The default value for this is 60 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The default value for this is 60 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Typically you do not need to change these defaults.
trans-unit.target: Typically you do not need to change these defaults.

trans-unit.source: However, if necessary, these intervals can be changed at an assembly level for all actor types in that assembly or at an actor type level using the `ActorGarbageCollection` attribute.
trans-unit.target: However, if necessary, these intervals can be changed at an assembly level for all actor types in that assembly or at an actor type level using the `ActorGarbageCollection` attribute.

trans-unit.source: The example below shows the change in the garbage collection intervals for HelloActor.
trans-unit.target: The example below shows the change in the garbage collection intervals for HelloActor.

trans-unit.source: To change default value of `ActorGarbageCollection` attribute at Assembly level, add following snippet to `AssemblyInfo.cs`.
trans-unit.target: To change default value of `ActorGarbageCollection` attribute at Assembly level, add following snippet to `AssemblyInfo.cs`.

trans-unit.source: For each actor in its Active Actors table, the Actors runtime keeps track of the amount of time it has been idle (i.e. not used).
trans-unit.target: For each actor in its Active Actors table, the Actors runtime keeps track of the amount of time it has been idle (i.e. not used).

trans-unit.source: The Actors runtime checks each of the actors every `ScanIntervalInSeconds` to see if it can be garbage collected and collects it if has been idle for `IdleTimeoutInSeconds`.
trans-unit.target: The Actors runtime checks each of the actors every `ScanIntervalInSeconds` to see if it can be garbage collected and collects it if has been idle for `IdleTimeoutInSeconds`.

trans-unit.source: Any time an actor gets used, its idle time reset to 0.
trans-unit.target: Any time an actor gets used, its idle time reset to 0.

trans-unit.source: After this, the actor can only be garbage collected if it again remains idle for `IdleTimeoutInSeconds`.
trans-unit.target: After this, the actor can only be garbage collected if it again remains idle for `IdleTimeoutInSeconds`.

trans-unit.source: Recall that an actor is considered to have been used if either an actor interface method an actor reminder callback is executed.
trans-unit.target: Recall that an actor is considered to have been used if either an actor interface method an actor reminder callback is executed.

trans-unit.source: An actor is **not** considered to have been used if its timer callback is executed.
trans-unit.target: An actor is **not** considered to have been used if its timer callback is executed.

trans-unit.source: The diagram below contains an example to illustrate these concepts.
trans-unit.target: The diagram below contains an example to illustrate these concepts.

trans-unit.source: The example assumes that there is only one active actor in the Active Actors table and shows the impact of actor method calls, reminders and timers on the lifetime of this actor.
trans-unit.target: The example assumes that there is only one active actor in the Active Actors table and shows the impact of actor method calls, reminders and timers on the lifetime of this actor.

trans-unit.source: The following points about the example are worth mentioning:
trans-unit.target: The following points about the example are worth mentioning:

trans-unit.source: ScanInterval and IdleTimeout are set to 5 and 10 respectively in the example (units do not matter here, since our purpose is only to illustrate the concept).
trans-unit.target: ScanInterval and IdleTimeout are set to 5 and 10 respectively in the example (units do not matter here, since our purpose is only to illustrate the concept).

trans-unit.source: The scan for actors to be garbage collected happens at T=0,5,10,15,20,25 as defined by the ScanInterval of 5.
trans-unit.target: The scan for actors to be garbage collected happens at T=0,5,10,15,20,25 as defined by the ScanInterval of 5.

trans-unit.source: A periodic timer fires at T=4,8,12,16,20,24 and its callback executes.
trans-unit.target: A periodic timer fires at T=4,8,12,16,20,24 and its callback executes.

trans-unit.source: It does not impact the idle time of the actor.
trans-unit.target: It does not impact the idle time of the actor.

trans-unit.source: An actor method call at T=7, resets the idle time to 0 and delays the garbage collection of the actor.
trans-unit.target: An actor method call at T=7, resets the idle time to 0 and delays the garbage collection of the actor.

trans-unit.source: An actor reminder callback executes at T=14 and further delays the garbage collection of the actor.
trans-unit.target: An actor reminder callback executes at T=14 and further delays the garbage collection of the actor.

trans-unit.source: During the garbage collection scan at T=25, the actor's idle time finally exceeds the IdleTimeout of 10 and the actor is garbage collected.
trans-unit.target: During the garbage collection scan at T=25, the actor's idle time finally exceeds the IdleTimeout of 10 and the actor is garbage collected.

trans-unit.source: Please note that an actor will never get garbage collected while it is executing one of its methods, no matter how much time is spent in executing that method.
trans-unit.target: Please note that an actor will never get garbage collected while it is executing one of its methods, no matter how much time is spent in executing that method.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned earlier, the execution of actor interface methods and reminder callbacks prevents garbage collection by resetting the actor's idle time to 0.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned earlier, the execution of actor interface methods and reminder callbacks prevents garbage collection by resetting the actor's idle time to 0.

trans-unit.source: The execution of timer callbacks does not reset the idle time to 0.
trans-unit.target: The execution of timer callbacks does not reset the idle time to 0.

trans-unit.source: However, the garbage collection of the actor is deferred until the timer callback has completed execution.
trans-unit.target: However, the garbage collection of the actor is deferred until the timer callback has completed execution.
